ontap.description: Fat Tire is a classic American Amber Ale. With aromas of biscuit, caramel, and an herbaceousness on the nose, with the biscuit notes coming across with notes of toastiness as well, balanced by enough hops to dry out the finish of this well-balanced ale.

Pilsner Urquell was the world's first pale lager, and its popularity meant it was much copied, and named pils, pilsner or pilsener. It is hopped with Saaz hops, a noble hop variety which is a key element in its flavour profile, as is the use of soft water.

The distinctive Ruby Red colour makes it unmistakably Smithwickâ€™s. With a refreshingly balanced taste, this is a blend of mild hops, sweet malt, and roasted barley. The gentle bitterness of the hops is perfectly complemented by the sweet, malty notes.
